content.description:
Pull onto the "pillar" that marks the right side of the cave. Relatively simple climbing gets you to a bad shake at the second bolt where the climbing gets pretty instantly serious. Head up and left to a stance under the corner/shield feature. This is about where you should look up and see that there is a hanger missing from the bolt that you would really like to clip...good luck!

Pull into the corner and eventually exit slightly left. Incredibly sharp slab above. 

Mix of reasonable bolts, old scary bolts, and a couple of rusted out Leaper's. 



From Graffiti Wall, head climbers right, up along the cliff band for ~15 m. Look for a downed tree in front of a wall/small cave. Belay out of the cave (you'll probably want more than flip flops to scramble up). This is the left bolt line - starts trending left after the second bolt. 

Scary bolts (13), chains

Start straight up from where you walk up to the wall, if you're not deterred by the first bolt, you may not be deterred by the missing hanger either. Climb the corner until you can traverse left (look for the modern bolt left of the extra rusted leaper) to merge with "Third Degree Burn" and rest below the shield/corner feature. Head up the corner (missing hanger) before finishing out on slab. 



Right-most line at Sun City Wall, basically goes right up the middle of the wall. Watch for your opportunity to cross bolt lines to the left. 

16 Bolts, chains

Head straight up the bolt line, trending slightly right to a hanging corner. Difficult moves get you onto the headwall, where the difficult drops substantially. 

The bolts are a little scary (old, rusty), and there is at least one bolt on a hollow flake that would probably end you if it came off. 



Right-most bolt line on Sun City Wall, basically in the middle of the wall. Trends right at ~1/3 height. 

13 bolts, chains

climbs.name: 5. No More Mr. Nice Guy (Graffiti Wall)

content.description:
Stressful climbing until the anchor. Start up the faint white streak - don't worry, the rock isn't teflon the whole way. Foot work and body position intensive climbing gets you to a good hold/stance above the last bolt. Traverse hard left before finishing. 

Consider stick clipping. 



Across from the main wall (Raven's Nest Buttress), look for a wall with a prominent white streak and a faint white streak. This line is in/right of the faint white streak (just left of the small cave/overhang)

5 bolts, rap rings

Solid rock, in-cut edges, giant holds and a roof. Slammin. Goes straight up ("Suspended Sentence" 11c branches to the right after the roof). 

Likely worth mentioning that there is a tricky section after the roof. 



Look for the bolt line that that goes up the left side of the small cave/overhang across from the main wall (Raven's Nest Buttress). 

5 bolts, rap rings

Climb to the top of the featureless face before veering right via a jug.  Once under the big triangle shaped roof, catch your breath before launching over the lip on the left into the crux.  

ravens
bolts

From the anchors of book worm or humingbird arete trend left under a roof and corner before climbing up a orange, lichen covered slab to a diagonal break. Rest and continue to
Anchors over the top of the wall. 

Entrance wall 
Bolts

This is an outstanding pitch of climbing- maybe one of the best in Alberta. Climb Abracadabra to tehtop of the featureless face but continue straight up through blocky roofs on small holds. Finish in the alcove above

ravens
bolts

After the warlocks crux, continue up on amazing technical climbing utilizing sloppers. A crimpy crux leads to a sport finish up a small corner. The texture of the holds inspired the name-  Its a toilet bowl company.  

ravens
bolts

Climb up a short pillar and follow edges to the right end of a big roof. Pumpy clmbing with big moves leads over the roof with a sporty finish.  

left side
bolts

Climb past the Hey Presto anchor through some fun, steeper terrain. The crux awaits you before the anchors.



Start on Hey Presto, very fun 10 a/b, continue past the Hey Presto anchors. 2nd line to left (?)  once you start up the Raven’s Nest gully.

13 bolts

Climb Guerilla Warefare to the second bolt before climbing up and left on crimpers to a shake. A hard move stabbing for an interesting "slot" and moving off it- stands between you and the anchors.

right side
bolts

Climb into the obvious, big corner and follow it to the anchors 

Entrance wall 
Bolts

A nasty boulder problem off the deck leads to really good movement through the first overhang. A good rest in the lower angle section lets your recover before smashing out the overhang on big holds to the chains (go pretty much straight up, the anchors are hidden from below but independent of the "Cerveza Sundae" anchors. 

Consider stick clipping. 



Find the flat gravel spot at the top of the gully, left of the Raven's main wall. This bolt line starts just right of the flat spot (3rd bolt line from the left). 

6 bolts, rusty chain anchor

Stick clip and boulder off the ground (come in from the left or the right). A sustained section of resistance climb on big holds (classic Carrot style open hand, pumpy!) leads to a mid-height no hands rest. 

Head straight up into the techy dihedral and exit left at the top. Rest where you can, and punch it through possibly the hardest sequence right at the chains!

The original line was the full "Sword in the Stone" but lower anchors were placed by popular demand to finish below the boulder problem. 



Look for the prominent dihedral in the middle of Raven's Nest Buttress. The first bolt line to the left is The Warlock/American Standard, Calibrun is the next bolt line to the left of that.

For Calibrun, stay right at the first bolt split, and left at the second bolt split. 

9 bolts, 2 bolt anchor with biners.

This is the steepest route on the cliff and starts in the very back of the cave. The hardest moves are found in the first half, but the redpoint crux comes after the lip where the pump becomes too much to handle.

middle
bolts

Start on a super-jug and rip a big lock-off to establish yourself on the wall (consider stick clipping). Once you're established, don't stop moving until you've gained the scoop where you can go no hands - a series of pinches brings you to a crimp blast over the bulge. 

Go straight up the thin tufa-feature before gaining more super jugs just left of the bolt line. It is ill-advised to slap over the lip in search of an anchor jug, just moss covered slopers up there!



Start from the flat spot at the top of the gully, just left of Raven's main wall. This is the second line from the left (right of the smooth water runnel). 


7 bolts, rusty chain anchor

Cruise up the right edge of the corner, before traversing right, onto the face, in the vicinity of the 5th bolt. Here, the rock shifts from teflon to textured. Victory climbing up/right, and then back left to rap rings (single pitch), or continue right to the big ledge if you're accessing the upper climbs. 



Look for the left facing corner in the middle of Raven's. This is the bolt line on the right edge of the corner. 

9 bolts, rap rings/chains

Small crimpers up a blank shield of rock lead to a stout boulder problem punching through the big roof.

Ravens Buttress
bolts

Start on the left side of the corner and climb onto
The arete. Veer left in order to pull over the bulge on the way to the anchor.

Entrance wall
Bolts

This great pitch links two crimp rails to a right handed slap for jugs at the end.  

The embankment wall 
bolts

Start just inside the right end of the cave. Powerful moves lead to a crux and a rest. Finish with black coffees crux. 

right side
bolts

Start in yellow rock and follow a weakness leftward before heading up a blank slab to a blue streak.


Entrance wall 
Bolts

Start just outside the left end of the cave. Powerful moves between flat holds give way to technical climbing and a very pumpy finish.  

left
bolts

Clip a long draw on the anchor and continue up a technical wall to a hard and committing crux below the anchors.

left
boltz

From the mid-wall ledge, ramble to your right using super-jugs, following the path of least resistance to the base of the overhanging arete. This involves some 4 bolts on traverse (long draw all of them) and a couple of generously placed bolts on the easy slab. 

Climb the arete on turbo-jugs, with a mini-boulder guarding the anchor (rap rings). 

This route was recently shown some love and has fresh Fixe hardware. Well worth the multi-pitch effort, the arete is spectacularly steep and exposed for the grade, with excellent 3D movement!

Probably easiest to tram back to the mid wall belay ledge instead of belaying from the top. Certainly makes rapping out easier!



From the mid-height ledge (straight above the left side of the steep overhang at the base of the wall), this is the right trending bolt-line up the blocky "ramp". Can be accessed from The Lizard, Gizzard, Coprophobia Express, Sidekick or The Illusionist, if you aim for the ledge at the top. 

10 bolts, 27 m.

Start just left of a missy corner. Follow good, buggy stone. 

Endurance wall right 
Bolts

A boulder problem ends at the second bolt. Pumpy climbing above leads to anchors in the overhang.  

ravens
bolts

Steep climbing on the outside far right lip of the Cave! As soon as you step on, feels like 5.12! Short but packs a punch.

Bolts 4

Start right of a corner with a very low first bolt, some delicate moves lead into fairly sustained climbing up slopers, small edges and other generally not great holds. A very insecure stance leads to clipping the chains.



Second bolted line from the left around the far left corner of Raven's Buttress.

8 bolts to a bolted anchor.

Climb book worm and continue straight up past a small roof to a cruxy bulge. 

Entrance wall 
Bolts

Start in a corner and head for black arete. The climbing is fun but very short lived.

Entrance wall 
Bolts

climbs.name: If Tuzo and Heidegger Had Kinder

content.description:
Start at the base of the scree slope below a yellow corner. A funky crux around the fourth bolt is followed by pumpy climbing out the roof. Be careful of the hollow sounding blocks

left side. first route
bolts

climbs.name: Its Not The length That Counts

content.description:
Left side. Follow a thin yellow streak up a small right facing corner to a few cruxy moves.

left
bolts

Alt finish of Carnivore. Hard and steep

middle
bolts

This beautiful line follows a blue streak up the 45 degree wall. Stick clip the second bolt and begin relentless climbing with hard clips that leads to a rest above the lip. Easier climbing leads to a heartbreaker crux at the top. 

middle
bolts

Start on the right side of the wall. Enjoy nice climbing on the clean face using underclings and sidepulls.

right
bolts

Enjoy great climbing up a beautiful grey streak. 

Entrance wall 
Bolts

Start three metres uphill of the previous route. Sustained climbing leads to a powerful and compact boulder problem out of a two-tiered roof. Classic

left side of cave
bolts

This pitch is hard right off the ground and doesn't let up till after the crux in the overhang.  Continue to anchors on the ledge above. 

ravens
bolts

Long route on big holds with some interesting sequences in the second half. Crux is up top to get over the bulge after the last bolt.



First boltline on top of the ledge around the corner at Raven's Nest Buttress.

Bolts and bolted anchor.

Difficult boulder problem start to easier climbing after the third bolt. Join up with Merlin's Laugh Left (10b) halfway up the right-trending ramp. It's 11a in the old version of Bow Valley Sport, 11c in the new version, but even then it feels pretty stout!



First boltline to the right of the classic Merlin's Laugh Left. 

Bolts

An absolute classic. Start up the leftmost corner of Raven's Nest Buttress before the wall turns around the corner. Climb the corner until you get to a good rest ledge before tackling a smooth slabby ramp on slopers, finally surmount a couple small overhangs to a difficult mantle finish.

Full value climbing and a must do for the crag. Use a long sling for the bolt before the midway ledge to reduce rope drag.



Left most route on Raven's Nest Buttress before the wall turns up the gully.

13 bolts to a bolted anchor. 13th bolt is optional to protect the second on the final move.

A worthwhile second pitch of Merlin's Laugh. Do not try to link together with the first pitch however as you'll experience heinous rope drag. Rappel twice to descend, even a 70m won't come close to making it in one rappel.



Continue up from Merlin's Laugh anchors for 6 bolts to a bolted anchor.

6 bolts to a bolted anchor.

Start in front of a small cave (it’s easier than it looks). Pull into a small corner before continuing straight up and over a diagonal break.

Entrance wall 
Bolts

With the bolt at the lip preclipped, walk downhill and start on Elmer Fudd. Trend right along a pumpy arete, which leads to a big scoop with a large roof above. Climb the right side of the scoop past project anchors to a bolt in the roof. Once in the corner above, a funky crux awaits

left
bolts

From the top of "Prince of Darkness" (accessed from the mid-height belay ledge), scramble up to the ledge with the abandoned namesake Raven's Nest. Clip the incredibly rusted Leaper hanger (back clean) to protect clipping the first real bolt, which must have been retrofitted circa 2010. Follow the diagonal slash up and right - really amazing movement, excellent quality rock. 

Pull the lip back to the right to reach the chain anchor. Tram back to the belay. I would suggest climbing "The Enchantress" to use those rap rings to get down. 

Note, there are a pair of rather scary looking, very rust hangers that were not retrofitted. I clipped these; realistically, you would never fall on these, they are sort of sympathy bolts. 



Look for the left slanting diagonal slash in the white/yellow rock ~40 m off the deck (left of the grey shield feature. This is your line!

9 bolts, chain anchor

Head for an open book corner in the yellow rock without being suckered into climbing straight up the corner. Finish up black rock.

Entrance wall 
Bolts

Step up onto the boulder and move left and up on insecure holds, slopers, weird pinches and awkward edges for 15 meters of sustained climbing with no real rests.



Start just left of the small boulder touching the middle of the gully wall above the small step. 

7 bolts to a bolted anchor.

Start in yellow rock, climb over a small roof and into a seam and pull onto a ledge. From here surmount the roof to reach the anchor.

Entrance wall
Bolts

Start just left of the bolt line and aim right, pulling quickly through the overhang before returning to the left side of the bolt line where a pair of victory jugs let you clip the second bolt. From here, easier, interesting movement on pinches brings you to a a decent rest at the last bolt (mostly following the half meter wide vertically fractured rock band that sticks out from the wall). Go right of the diving board on wrist deep buckets to clip the anchor.

A worthy climb, despite being overshadowed by the stellar "magic" climbs to the right. 



Furthest left route in the gully on the left side of the main wall. Follows the left edge of the wall, just right of the polished water runnel. 


7 bolts, fixed anchor (rusty chains direct to bolts)

Approach climb on big holds to a bolt length of resistance climbing. Launch into a boulder on pinches and side-pulls protected by the last bolt. Turn the lip on big holds to an anchor set back from the edge.



Find the pillar just right of the cave on Raven's Nest Buttress. There are two lines that go up the pillar, this is the left one. 

4 bolts (5 if you don't skip the first bolt) + rap rings

The name sums it up. Difficult underclings lead to the crux; a couple of poor edges with less than desirable footholds.

embankment wall
bolts

Climb the prominent left-facing corner of Abracadabra to the base of the shield feature. Trend right along the weakness to the top of the face before rejoining Abracadabra through the overhang. Save some energy and patience for turning the lip onto the slab top-out!



Head up the gully at the end of the Raven's Nest Buttress creek face. Look for the blank face/shield feature and a high alcove. This line passes on the right side of the shield, trends slightly back left over the top of the shield and then straight up through the overhang for the alcove. 

13 bolts + rap rings

Slopers and desperate feet. Climb relatively easy terrain to a high first bolt (consider stick clipping) and then race the pump through several meters of slippery open hand holds and glassy feet. The angle eases and the rock becomes more textured up high - victory climbing to the chains. 



Find the right leaning corner/ramp in the middle of Raven's Nest Buttress; this line is the third bolt line to the right of the corner (first bolt line left of/that does not go through the cave like feature)

8 bolts + rap rings

The left most route features great sustained climbing up a slightly overhung face. Trying to find the correct holds in the bubbly rock is bound to get your forearms throbbing before teh crux above the small roof.

across the stream from the cave 
bolts

Climb "Caliburn" and continue for 1 more bolt. From the anchor of Caliburn, pull a short V3 boulder, clip your bolt, and continue for a meter or so of easy climbing to the rap rings. 

5.12c = V3? Count on being flamed when you start the boulder. 



See "Caliburn", Sword in the Stone is the original full value line. 

11 bolts, rap rings

Begin this classic just left of a large corner. Big moves between good holds leads to a fat undercling. The wall gets steeper. A great crux on pumpy holds is followed by a traverse right and the anchors.

ravens
bolts

This is a superb route on excellent stone.  Once you've clipped the 2nd bolt, climb back down and back clean the first.  The crux comes pulling the roof down low, but dont be fooled, the rest is sustained and on perfect edges of all sizes. 

Summer in SIAM wall
Bolts

Follow black rock to blue freaks and good holds. Tricky near the start.

Entrance wall 
Bolts

Start at the base of Cup O Joe, but trend left for three bolts before climbing straight up to finish on the lizard. 

ravens
bolts

Sloppers! Love em, especially with the slick texture Carrot Creek provides. Boulderers will be in heaven. There is many walls and sectors here, with Ravens Nest and The Cave being the premier. Everything from 5.7 to 5.14b.  There is a lot of wildlife here; tread lightly.
